Event: BC The Julian calendar takes effect for the first time
Prophet Muhammad sets out with an army 10,000 strong to conquer Mecca

The International Commission on Zoological Nomenclature establish the "starting point" for standardized species names across the animal kingdom, based on the binomial nomenclature by Carolus Linnaeus 10th edition of Systema Naturae
Emancipation Proclamation issued by Abraham Lincoln to free slaves in US confederate states
Ellis Island opens as a US immigration inspection station - it would go on to be the gateway to the US for more than 12 million people
German physicist Wilhelm Röntgen announces his discovery of x-rays
European Economic Community, better known as the European Common Market starts operation
The first TV detector van, used to track down users of unlicensed television sets, begins operation in the UK
Johnny Cash plays first of many free concerts behind bars
1st Rose Bowl, Tournament Park, Pasadena, California: Michigan beats Stanford, 49-0; MVP: Neil Snow, Michigan, FB
Roman Emperor Claudius marries his fourth wife and niece Agrippina the Younger
King Ataulf of Narbonne marries emperor Honorius sister Galle Placidia
US founding father Thomas Jefferson (30) marries Martha Wayles Skelton (23)
The Alamanni cross the frozen Rhine River in large numbers, invading the Roman Empire
Muhammad XII, the last Emir of Granada, surrenders his city to Ferdinand II of Aragon and Isabel I of Castile, ending both the Reconquista and centuries of Muslim rule in the Iberian peninsula
Tsar Ivan the Terrible's march to Novgorod begins
American anarcho-syndicalist union known as the Industrial Workers of the World forms
World War II: the 28 nations at war with Axis powers pledge to make no separate peace deals
Mahatma Gandhi begins march for peace in East Bengal
1st "Bob Cummings Show" premieres on NBC (later on CBS)
Richard Wagner's opera "The Flying Dutchman" premieres in Dresden

"The Epic in Miami", in 85 degree heat (Fahrenheit), the San Diego Chargers defeat the Miami Dolphins 41-38 in overtime in the AFC Divisional Playoff Game, a game that set numerous playoff scoring records
Leading Romantic poet Lord Byron (27) marries Anne Isabella Milbanke (22) by special licence, at Seaham Hall in County Durham
Explorer and medical missionary David Livingstone (31) weds Mary Moffat
Physicist J. J. Thomson (33) weds Rose Elisabeth Paget
Leonardo da Vinci unsuccessfully tests a flying machine
Martin Luther is Excommunicated by Pope Leo X from the Roman Catholic Church for failing to recant parts of his Ninety-five Theses which started the Protestant Reformation
General George Washington's revolutionary army defeats British forces at Battle of Princeton, New Jersey
Benito Mussolini dissolves the Italian parliament and proclaims himself dictator of Italy, taking the title "Il Duce" (the Leader)
Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs incorporate Apple Computer, Inc
Israel government confirms resettlement of 10,000 Ethiopian Jews
After hosting the show for over 30 years, Casey Kasem gives up the hosting duties of "American Top 40" to Ryan Seacrest
Aretha Franklin is the first female artist to be inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
Australian cricket icon Don Bradman follows up a 1st innings of 79 to score 112 in 3rd Test v England in Melbourne; his 1st of 29 Test centuries
US Chief Justice of the Supreme Court John Marshall (27) weds Mary Willis Ambler in Hanover County, Virginia
German politician Hermann Goering (30) weds Carin Hulda (34)
MLB catcher Roy Campanella (18) weds Bernice Ray
Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber (41) divorces singer/dancer Sarah Brightman (29) after almost 7 years of marriage
Samuel Colt sells his first revolver pistol to the United States government
New York Stock Exchange opens its 1st permanent headquarters at 10-12 Broad St, near Wall Street in New York City
Luna 1 (Mechta) becomes 1st craft to leave Earth's gravity
Longest recorded strike ends as the Danish barbers' assistants end a 33 year strike
The 110th United States Congress convenes and elects Nancy Pelosi as the 1st female Speaker of the House
"Night Court" starring Harry Anderson premieres on NBC TV
Billboard magazine publishes its 1st music hit parade
1st Black baseball league, National Negro Baseball League, organizes
Naturalist and entomologist Thomas Say (39) secretly weds natural science illustrator Lucy Way Sistare (26)
Composer Irving Berlin (37) weds heiress Ellin Mackay in a simple civil ceremony
Czech Republic's first president Vaclav Havel (60) weds Czech actress Dagmar Havlova (43) in Prague, Czech Republic
Britney Spears has her surprise marriage annulled less than 55 hours after tying the knot with childhood friend Jason Alexander at the Little White Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas

Australian pop diva Natalie Imbruglia (32) and "Silverchair" frontman Daniel Johns (28) announce their divorce stating "we have simply grown apart through not being able to spend enough time together"
Battle of Nancy, Burgundy vs Switzerland, 7,000 + killed including their leader Charles Duke of Burgundy
British naval expedition led by Benedict Arnold burns Richmond, Virginia
German Workers' Party forms, precursor to the National Socialist German Workers' Party (Nazi)
Mao Zedong writes "A Single Spark Can Start a Prairie Fire"
US President Harry Truman labels his administration the "Fair Deal"
"Cavalcade" based on the play by Noël Coward, directed by Frank Lloyd and starring Diana Wynyard and Clive Brook premieres in New York (Best Production/Picture 1934)
Francesco Cavalli's opera "Giasone" premieres in Venice (the most popular opera of the 17th century)
Brian Lara scores his maiden Test century with 277 for the West Indies v Australia in drawn 3rd Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground
Pope Clemens VII forbids English King Henry VIII to remarry
Explorer William Clark (37) weds Julia Hancock in Fincastle, Virginia
British PM Neville Chamberlain (41) weds Anne de Vere Cole
Actor Lee Marvin (42) divorces Elizabeth Ebeling after 14 years of marriage
The English Rump Parliament votes to put Charles I on trial for treason and other "high crimes"

Geophysicist and meteorologist Alfred Wegener presents his controversial theory of continental drift in a lecture at the Geological Association (Geologischen Vereinigung) at the Senckenberg-Museum, Frankfurt
US President Franklin Roosevelt makes his "Four Freedoms" speech (freedom of speech and worship; freedom from want and fear) during his US State of Union address
Astronomers at University of California see 1st sight of birth of a galaxy
"Wheel Of Fortune" debuts on NBC-TV
1st recorded boxing match (Duke of Albemarle's butler vs his butcher)
US 1st President George Washington marries Martha Dandridge Custis at White House Plantation
Author Harriet Beecher (24) weds educator Calvin Ellis Stowe (33) in Cincinnati, Ohio
Theoretical Physicist Albert Einstein (23) weds Mileva Maric
Galileo Galilei discovers the first three moons of Jupiter: Io, Europa & Ganymede
Typewriter patented by Englishman Henry Mill (built years later)
Chinese Kuomintang forces under orders from Chiang Kai-shek open fire on the surrounded Communist New Fourth Army at Maolin, Anhui Province, killing or capturing 7,000 troops
US President Harry Truman announces American development of the hydrogen bomb
Georgetown-IBM experiment, 1st public demonstration of a machine translation system, is held at IBM's head office in New York
President Bill Clinton's impeachment trial begins in the US Senate after the House voted to impeach him for lying about his affair with Monica Lewinsky
William K.L. Dickson captures "Fred Ott's Sneeze" as a motion picture at Thomas Edison's Black Mariah Studio, West Orange, New Jersey [1]
Marian Anderson becomes the 1st African American to perform with the New York Metropolitan Opera
Gibson issued US patent for the Flying V Guitar
Marian Anderson becomes the 1st African American to perform with the New York Metropolitan Opera
Los Angeles Lakers defeat the Atlanta Hawks, 134-90 for their 33rd straight win, the longest winning streak in major professional sports
Composer Pier Cavalli marries rich widow Maria Sosomeno
Dutch King Willem II marries Emma von Waldeck-Pyrmont
Pianist Ignacy Jan Paderewski (19) weds Antonina Korsak
Actress-singer Janet Jackson (18) divorces fellow R&B singer James DeBarge (21) only 4 months after getting married
Oldest surviving commercial newspaper begins (Haarlem, Netherlands)
1st US President George Washington delivers 1st state of the union address
US national debt is $0 for the first and only time in history

Chiefs, representatives of people's and church organisations, and other prominent individuals form the African National Congress and declare its aim to bring all Africans together as one people to defend their rights and freedoms
WWI: ANZAC forces withdraw from the Gallipoli Peninsula after Ottoman forces successfully defend access to Constantinople
Abdulaziz Ibn Saud becomes King of Nejd and Hejaz; forerunner of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
TV series "All Creatures Great and Small" debuts on BBC TV, based on the books by James Herriot, starring Robert hardy and Christopher Timothy
Elvis Presley's "Don't Be Cruel" and "Hound Dog" single goes #1 and stays #1 for a record 11 weeks (for a single)

Michael Jordan's game-high 35 points leads Chicago to 120-95 win over Milwaukee; gives him exactly 20,000 points in 620th game of his NBA career; 2nd-fastest to reach milestone after Wilt Chamberlain (499)
US Vice President John C. Calhoun (28) weds Floride Bonneau (19)
Belgium Princess Marie-Jose marries Italian's crown prince Umberto
Actor Burgess Meredith (43) weds ballerina Kaja Sundsten
Louis XII of France after papal divorce marries Anne, Duchess of Brittany to keep duchy for the crown
Actress Jayne Mansfield and public relations manager Paul Mansfield's divorce is finalized, after 7-1/2 years of marriage
Roseanne Barr files for divorce from 3rd husband Ben Thomas
Judges' investigations for the trial of Joan of Arc begin in Rouen, France, the seat of the English occupation government
Afghans defeat Marathas in battle of Barari Ghat
Daguerreotype photo process announced at French Academy of Science
Ernest Shackleton as part of the British Nimrod Expedition reaches a record farthest South latitude (88°23' south)
6,000 Jews murdered in a pogrom in Bucharest, Romania
Apple Inc CEO Steve Jobs announces the iPhone
"Rawhide" with Clint Eastwood premieres on CBS TV
Michael Jackson receives the Artist of the Century award at the American music awards
Baseball officially bans Pete Rose from being elected to Hall of Fame for betting on baseball
Pope Martinus V declares Jacqueline, Countess of Haintaut's marriage to Humphrey Duke of Gloucester invalid
Sir Rudolph Bing (of NY Met Opera) marries Lady Carroll Douglass
English earl of St Andrews marries Sylvana Tomaselli
